revised_title: Anatomy and Function of the Vertebrate Liver
tldr: This study examines the structure and function of the vertebrate liver, focusing on liver lobules, hepatic cells, and their development. The author describes the arrangement of liver columns, bile canaliculi, and the role of hepatic veins in the liver's structure. Additionally, the study discusses the differentiation of hepatic cells and the anabolic and katabolic processes within them.
